div.p:
Sils-Baselgia, Engadine
Sept. 2d, 1942
Klaus, dear, old, unchanged one,
yes, it is strange, and extremely pleasing to be at
Sils again at the same table in the same good
Stube surrounded by the still marvellous mountain
+ splendid summer landscape, + the friendly atmos
phere of the village. And it was strange + an extreme
joy to receive your letter – almost from "house to
house" + hand to hand – after the long + partly
bitter isolation of deep black Africa. But Lisbon has
been, meanwhile, a midway station where many lively
thinge became real again. I had, then, a letter
from Erica, + I heard about her by Mr. Balfour (whom
I like very much). Fate, routes + events have been
so unexpected + curious, that I am ready to
believe we shall see each other again, before not
to long, before we are gray + white or changed. May
be you have become a soldier, – may be I shall
have finished my poem "The Miracle of the Tree"
which is more than an entierly new version
of the first manuscript, – a novel, – which I had
brought back from the hardship + strange
paradise of The Congo. I am working at it,
sacrifising all I have in strength + love
+ also the potential "holyday" & meeting
with friends etc. I had planned for my
3 monts summer at home - But even that
this kind of concentration, which is the true
parallel of a religious aim or meditation –
is hard upon me, I feel that I write

write the first time as I was supposed
to do – giving my best, my whole effort.
The result is very suprising, + far beyond
my own knowledge or thinking – yet I find,
reading it, that each word + line is true,
+ comes direct from the common source of
experience + innocence. – So, should the Swiss
Consul Mr. Orlandi send you the copy of the
first novel, dont consider it – it will be
burnt + melted.

I had news from Carson, and hope she got my
last cable from Sils. I wish with all my
heart she will be strong enough to finish
a new book. News about Margot [von Opel, zu dieser Zeit wohl schon in den USA interniert] are hopeless –
I had a long desperate letter from her, all her
most charming character hardened + yet sweetened
by suffering – I try what I can do but until
now without much result. And it is not up to
us to say aloud that possibly this – almost
com[m]on – experience might be her chance, as
"good men improve by suffering" –

I had Giehse for almost 5 weeks. Still a
soul + a comrade. In about 6 weeks I
have to start again for Lisbon, with a good
arrangement with our papers [offenbar sind schon Verträge aufgesetzt?]. I do hope to
get more news. Dont be sad about "decision" [KMs zweite Exilzeitschrift überlebte nicht lange] –
the time will come when our bit will have
another place again – + we have to keep fit
+ get better + surer, that is all we have to do –
the rest is beyond our plans. I would love

to see Erika + you – will she possibly come to Lisbon? Give my love to
your parents, Golo, and all friends, + all my affection + love to E.
How is dear Annette [ev. Annette Kolb]? Write soon, + be sure of our oldest friendship
+ my tenderness. Your
Miro
